üöÄ In a recent episode of FP&A Today, Daniel Sousa-Lennox Mej√≠a, a data scientist at Microsoft with extensive experience in financial analysis, revealed how Microsoft's finance team, comprising around 5000 professionals, ventured into the world of machine learning for forecasting. The team introduced FINN (Microsoft Finance Time Series Forecasting Framework), a revolutionary AI tool that has taken financial forecasting to new heights. Using machine learning and AI finance tools like FINN, the Microsoft finance team has bid farewell to the days of cumbersome forecasting and Excel spreadsheet gymnastics. The impact has been remarkable. One striking example is the team's ability to predict Azure product revenue (Microsoft's cloud computing platform) with an astounding 99% accuracy! üéØ However, as Daniel Sousa-Lennox wisely points out, AI is not a silver bullet; its effectiveness depends on the quality of data. While not every forecast will reach 99% accuracy, the results are undeniably transformative for a $2 trillion company like Microsoft. FINN itself offers access to over 25 models, supporting forecasts on a daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and yearly basis. This has revolutionized the approach to Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A). On average, using FINN, a forecast that previously took a week to complete can now be done in just one to one and a half hours, freeing up valuable time for finance professionals. In this podcast episode Sousa-Lennox sheds light on Microsoft's groundbreaking journey into AI-driven financial forecasting. Remember, innovation is the key to staying ahead, and AI is a game-changer that's redefining the world of finance. You can check out the episode here: https://okt.to/u3pG0Q What are your thoughts on using AI-driven financial forecasting?
